attributes.action: Make the rail companies at least reimburse its customers their train fares when they cancel all their services.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Southeastern trains cancelled all their services on Monday the 2nd of February 2009 but if you hold a monthly or above season ticket you won't be getting back any proportion of your fare that you have paid for this service. This is due to point 45 of the passenger charter re compensation. Apparently if the incident which causes the cancellation is "outside of the control of the train company" then they don't to pay their customers any money back. This applies to all train companies at all times of the year. My petition to the Prime Minister to remove this ridiculous rule and make train companies at least pay back ALL paying customers their fare for the relevant period that trains are cancelled or delayed.
